title: Dad killed in hit-and-run horror was mowed down in front of his nine-year-old son
text:

A nine-year-old boy watched in horror as his dad was mowed down by a hit-and-run driver and left for dead in the road. 
Shahid Tarafdar's young son witnessed the moment his dad was fatally struck by the car which was caught on camera after the tragic collision. 
The brave youngster called his mother just moments later to tell her the tragic news about his 45-year-old father. 
Mr Tarafdar was killed when he was crossing a road to get some food while taking his son home from school, the Manchester Evening News reports. Shahid Tarafdar died in hospital after being hit by the car (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
He parked his car on Stockport Road in Longsight, Manchester, and left his mobile phone with his son as he nipped across the busy road. Read More Emotional tributes paid to tragic teen pair killed after driver smashed car into tree 
But when the dad tried to return to his car, he was struck by a silver Peugeot 307 which then sped off from the scene. 
As the father-of-three lay injured in the road, his son called his mother and uncle to tell them. 
Several passers-by ran to the assistance of Mr Tarafdar, who was rushed to Manchester Royal Infirmary by ambulance, but later died after Tuesday afternoon's collision. 
His brother Shabuddin Tarafdar, 47, said the family are supporting the young boy after his traumatic ordeal. CCTV of the hit-and-run driver of a Peugeot 307 (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
He said: “It happened in front of his son. 
“On the day of the incident he went and picked up his child from school and parked the car to go and pick up some food for his children. Read More 
“He left his child in the car just across the road. He left his phone with the son and picked the food up and walked out onto the road - we know he was observant. 
"He was clearly visible to the driver and that’s when the driver ran him over. 
“At that time he didn’t know what the situation was but it was witnessed by his son who has had to phone his mum and his uncle to tell them.” 
Shocking CCTV footage filmed in the moments immediately after the collision shows the killer hit-and-run driver mounting the pavement and speeding through red lights. 
The driver of the car, registration number KW55 EVP, can be seen racing down Stockport Road and stopping to let a hooded passenger out. 
The Peugeot 307 then speeds off down the main road towards the junction with Kirkmanshulme Lane where it turns right. Police are trying to trace the driver of the Peugot (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
Footage shows the car driving through red lights at a junction, close to several other vehicles. 
The silver car then mounts the pavement, narrowly avoiding pedestrians, before speeding away from the scene. 
Police say the Peugeot was later discovered on fire at Rimmers Close, in Beswick. 
Mr Tarafdar was a devoted husband and father to two young boys and a girl, all aged between two and 11-years-old. 
Originally from Southampton, where he worked as a chef cooking Indian cuisine, he moved to Manchester with his family around five years ago. Read More Two teenage brothers killed three minutes into police chase which ended when car hit tree 
He worked as a taxi driver and also ran The Pound Shop on Dickenson Road, in Longsight. 
Shabuddin said his brother was a much-loved and valued member of the community with strong links to the Shahjalal Mosque. 
He said: “He was born under my wing and was living with me with our family. He would have helped out anyone and whenever you needed him he was there. 
“It’s very hard to take in. There is nothing we can say that was bad about him at all. He was loved by everyone and liked by everyone. 
“He was a very happy chappy type person and was always there for other people. 
“The main thing is he was a very, very devoted family man to his wife and children. His kids loved him to bits.” 
Making an emotional appeal for the driver of the car to hand himself in Shabuddin said: “It’s a shock to everyone that it’s happened at such a young age to a man with a young family. 
“All I want is for the driver to be caught and brought to justice.” 
Detectives investigating the collision have vowed to catch the driver of the car and say they will not rest until the person is brought to justice. Read More Teenager jailed for killing charity worker after smashing into stationary car on motorway while 'lost in daydream' 
They are appealing for witnesses to the collision, which happened on Stockport Road at around 3.45pm on Tuesday, to come forward. 
Senior Investigating Officer, Sergeant Lee Westhead, appealed for anyone with information about the collision to call GMP on 101, or Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111 quoting log number 1376/February 7. 
He said: “My team and I will not rest until we find the driver, we will be relentless in our search and we will use every possible means available to us to identify them. 
"It is only a matter of time until we find you. Come and speak to me before we come knocking on your door. This will not go away, the investigation will not end until this is resolved. 
“For those who have helped or who are considering helping this driver, this is not the time for false loyalties, a man has died. The police will identify and prosecute anyone who is found to have committed offences in relation to this collision.” Like us on Facebook
